item.title: Common yarrow (*Achillea millefolium*)
item.description: Yarrow is a highly versatile perennial, particularly valuable for relieving menstrual cramps, digestive issues, colds, fevers, and for healing wounds.

item.title: Creeping thyme (*Thymus serpyllum*)
item.description: The remarkably fragrant dwarf shrub or the creeping thyme prefers growing on stony ground, and its healing effects are helpful for coughs, colds, and indigestion. Thymus serpyllum can be used to make tea, tincture, or syrup.

item.title: Denseflower mullein (*Verbascum densiflorum*)
item.description: Denseflower mullein or Verbascum densiflorum is a biennial medicinal plant traditionally used to relieve cough, bronchitis, and inflammations of the throat and ear. Most often, its flowers are collected, and less commonly its leaves and roots.

item.title: Eastern purple coneflower (*Echinacea purpurea*)
item.description: Echinacea purpurea is a beautiful ornamental plant with proven effects on cough, flu, colds, and strengthening the immune system.

item.title: Sweet wormwood (*Artemisia annua*)
item.description: Sweet wormwood is a highly beneficial medicinal plant with proven effects in treating malaria and cancer. It is traditionally used for various ailments and diseases, from viral illnesses to menstrual cramps.
